alert.note: Alert for Mendocino Coast (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Advisory issued March 27 at 3:54AM PDT until March 28 at 5:00AM PDT by NWS Eureka
info.description: ...FREEZE WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM PDT THIS MORNING... ...WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 4 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 5 AM PDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...For the Freeze Warning, sub-freezing temperatures as low as 29. For the Wind Advisory, southeast winds 25 to 35 mph with gusts up to 55 mph expected. * WHERE...Mendocino Coast. Winds will be strongest on exposed coastal headlands. * WHEN...For the Freeze Warning, until 9 AM PDT this morning. For the Wind Advisory, from 4 PM this afternoon to 5 AM PDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Gusty winds could blow around unsecured objects. Tree limbs could be blown down and a few power outages may result. Frost and freeze conditions will kill crops and other sensitive vegetation.
info.instruction: Use extra caution when driving, especially if operating a high profile vehicle. Secure outdoor objects. Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold. Provide adequate shelter for outdoor pets or consider bringing them indoors. Frost Advisories and Freeze Warnings are issued during the local growing season as defined by climatology and local agriculture experts. Once the growing season has ended these statements will no longer be issued until the spring.
